header.name: chaos/preprocessor/tuple/batch.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines primitives used to unroll by processing batches of elements.

macro.abstract: The macro is a predicate that determines whether its second argument contains at least the number of elements specified by its first argument.

usage.param: The batch size. Valid values range from 1 to .

macro.para: If tuple contains at least n elements, this macro expands to 1. Otherwise, it expands to 0.
The primary utility of this macro is to determine if tuple can be unrolled by a factor of n.
This macro operates on the nil representation used by the core operations defined in . Specifically, () is a one-element , not a zero-element .
